data.title: PepsiCo in charts: Sequential seasonal growth seen across all segments in Q4
Lennox International downgraded at Wells Fargo on A2L pricing doubts
data.description:
Lennox International (NYSE:LII) on Monday was downgraded to Underweight from a previous investment rating of Equal weight by analysts at financial-services firm Wells Fargo. They said the maker of heating and cooling equipment faces limits on prices for A2L, a refrigerant that is considered more climate-friendly than older chemicals.

“Operational execution has been impressive, especially the rapid improvement in Building Control System margins,” Joseph O’Dea, analyst at Wells Fargo, said in a February 3 report. “Margin expansion, BCS emergency replacement share gain and inorganic growth remain attractive opportunities. However, we think elevated uncertainties add risk to 2025 that favors multiple compression.”

Wells Fargo cut its price target on Lennox (NYSE:LII) to $580 a share from $630 a share previously, based on an estimated multiple of 25 times adjusted earnings per share for 2025, a premium to an industry multiple of 23.5 times.

data.title: Axalta Coating Systems beats top-line estimates; initiates Q1 and FY25 outlook
data.description:
• Axalta Coating Systems press release (NYSE:AXTA): Q4 Non-GAAP EPS of $0.60 beats by $0.09.
  • Revenue of $1.31B (+1.6% Y/Y) in-line.
  • Record fourth quarter Adjusted EBITDA of $275 million.
  • Adjusted EBITDA margin improved 170 basis points year over year.
  • Fourth quarter 2024 cash provided by operating activities was $234 million versus $286 million in the same period last year, with free cash flow totaling $177 million compared to $254 million in the prior year period.
  • The company's net debt to trailing twelve-month Adjusted EBITDA ratio (total net leverage ratio) was 2.5x at quarter-end versus 2.9x as of December 31, 2023.

  • Financial Guidance

    First Quarter and Full Year 2025 Outlook:

    Free Cash Flow ~$500
    Depreciation and Amortization ~$285

data.title: Sun Country Non-GAAP EPS of $0.27 beats by $0.07, revenue of $260.4M beats by $2.36M

data.title: Ingredion reports mixed Q4 results; initiates FY25 outlook
data.description:
• Ingredion press release (NYSE:INGR): Q4 Non-GAAP EPS of $2.63 beats by $0.07.
  • Revenue of $1800M (-6.3% Y/Y) misses by $60M.
  • Cash from operations was $1,436 million, up from $1,057 million in 2023, reflecting changes in working capital.
  • Reported and adjusted effective tax rates for the quarter were 36.2% and 25.2%, respectively, compared to 24.4% and 24.9% for the year-ago period.
  • Net capital expenditures were $295 million, down $19 million from the prior year.
  • In 2024, the company returned $426 million to shareholders, including $216 million of share repurchases.
  • The company expects its full-year 2025 outlook for reported and adjusted EPS to be in the range of $10.75 to $11.55 vs. $11.20 consensus.

data.title: PepsiCo reports mixed Q4 results; initiates FY25 outlook and raises dividend
data.description:
• PepsiCo press release (NASDAQ:PEP): Q4 Non-GAAP EPS of $1.96 beats by $0.02.
  • Revenue of $27.78B (-0.3% Y/Y) misses by $110M.
  • Guidance and Outlook: The company provides guidance on a non-GAAP basis as we cannot predict certain elements which are included in reported GAAP results, including the impact of foreign exchange translation and commodity mark-to-market net impacts.
  • For 2025, the company expects: • A low-single-digit increase in organic revenue; and • A mid-single-digit increase in core constant currency EPS vs. consensus of $8.53. In addition, the Company expects: • A core annual effective tax rate of approximately 20 percent; and • Total cash returns to shareholders of approximately $8.6 billion, comprised of dividends of $7.6 billion and share repurchases of $1.0 billion.
  • The company also expects a foreign exchange translation headwind of approximately 3-percentagepoints to negatively impact reported net revenue and core EPS growth, based on current market consensus rates. This assumption and the guidance above imply a low-single-digit increase to core EPS in 2025 compared to 2024 core EPS of $8.16.
  • Dividend Increase: The company today announced a 5 percent increase in its annualized dividend to $5.69 per share from $5.42 per share, effective with the dividend expected to be paid in June 2025. This represents the Company’s 53rd consecutive annual dividend per share increase.

data.title: Stock index futures inch lower as China hits back with tariffs on U.S. imports
data.description:
Stock index futures were lower on Tuesday as China retaliated with a levy of tariffs on imports of multiple U.S. products.

S&P 500 futures (SPX) -0.1%, Nasdaq 100 futures (US100:IND) -0.1%, and Dow futures (INDU) -0.2%.

The 10-year Treasury yield (US10Y) rose 1 basis point to 4.58%. The 2-year yield (US2Y) was flat at 4.27%.

The Chinese government said it would implement a 15% tariff on coal and liquefied natural gas products, as well as a 10% tariff on crude oil, agricultural machinery, and large-displacement cars.

Wall Street closed lower on Monday after President Donald Trump announced new tariffs on Canada and Mexico over the weekend. While it was a red day, markets were able to recoup some earlier losses after delays were announced against tariffs towards Mexico.

"The past 24 hours have seen a big roundtrip for many assets classes as strongly negative sentiment gave way to a relief rally on news that the planned 25% tariffs against Mexico and Canada would be delayed," Deutsche Bank's Jim Reid said.

Although U.S. futures have dipped, along with the rest of Asia after China's immediate retaliation came though, markets remain higher and are rebounding from yesterday's selloff, Reid added.

"Taxing goods from China is still happening, and China has retaliated. The inflation consequences of these taxes are less obvious to US consumers," UBS' Paul Donovan said.

On the earnings side, Google parent Alphabet (GOOGL) (GOOG) is expected to release its fourth quarter results.

Traders were also awaiting the December Job Openings and Labor Turnover Survey report, which will land during market hours, and is expected to fall to 8.010M.

U.S. job vacancy data is due. The survey response rate is tiny, making the data an imprecise guide, Donovan said.

data.title: U.S. Dollar gives up gains as China slaps tariffs on U.S. imports
data.description:
The U.S. dollar gave up some gains on Tuesday as China hit back with sweeping tariffs on imports of multiple U.S. products.

The greenback had skyrocketed over the weekend, climbing to a three-week high on early Monday after President Donald Trump lived up to his promise and imposed tariffs on imports from Canada, Mexico, and China.

Trump, however, agreed to “immediately pause” tariffs on Mexico and Canada for a month, following successful negotiations with their respective leaders.

The U.S. dollar index rose 0.15% to 108.6, but later surrendered gains and was down 0.46% to 108.49 at the time of writing.

Both the Canadian dollar (CAD:USD) and Mexican pesos (MXN:USD) were down 0.13% against the U.S. dollar.

While the Chinese yuan (USD:CNY) traded 0.35% lower in offshore trading. Chinese markets are still closed for the New Year holiday.

"In addition to swings for the Mexican peso and Canadian dollar, the US dollar strength came as the Euro weakened," Deutsche Bank's Jim Reid said.

The Euro against the U.S. dollar was down 0.15% to 1.0326 on fears that Trump could levy tariffs on the European Union next.

data.title: CIB Marine Bancshares sets $1M stock buyback plan
data.description:
• CIB Marine Bancshares (OTCQX:CIBH) has authorized a 2025 share repurchase program for up to $1M worth of the company’s outstanding common stock.
  • Repurchases are expected to commence in the first quarter of 2025.
  • This marks the company’s first common stock repurchase program since completing the repurchase of all company-issued preferred stock in 2024.
  • Source: Press Release
